headline: FTC Seeks Information From Top Advertising Agencies as Part of Ad-Boycott Probe
summary: The Federal Trade Commission is asking some of the world’s largest ad companies for information as part of an investigation into whether advertising and advocacy groups violated antitrust laws by coordinating boycotts of certain sites, including  Elon Musk’s  X.  The FTC on Monday sent requests for information to agencies including  Omnicom Group WPP Dentsu Havas Interpublic Group Publicis Groupe  and Horizon Media, a spokesman for the FTC confirmed.  The newest round of civil investigative demands are part of the antitrust agency’s probe of organizations including nonprofit media watchdog Media Matters and Ad Fontes Media, which rates the quality of news sources for advertisers.
